results.title: Ulster
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scenic and sporting attractions of Northern Ireland and records, in particular, sequences from recent Tourist Trophy motor and Grand Prix motor-cycle events (featuring Stirling Moss). The film includes a visit to Belfast, capital of Northern Ireland; scenic attractions among the mountain and lake country; a visit to Carlingford Lough and the Silent Valley; a drive through the Glen of Antrim to Portrush, famous for its swimming, sailing and its golf course.
results.description: Shows some of the scenic and sporting attractions of Northern Ireland and records, in particular, sequences from recent Tourist Trophy motor and Grand Prix motor-cycle events (featuring Stirling Moss). results.title: UK Prime Minister in Africa
results.brief_description: Scenes from Mr Harold MacMillan’s tour of Africa in the spring of 1960. Accompanied by Lady Dorothy MacMillan, the Prime Minister visits Ghana, Nigeria and the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland, witnessing both the spectacular material progress in these quickly developing territories and the friendliness and goodwill which have not been affected by the achievement of the prospect of independence.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari [Extract]
results.creator_credit: Contemporary Films and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: An extract from what is considered to be a masterpiece of Japanese director, Kenji Mizoguchi. Set in sixteenth century Japan, its theme is that of the humble commoner who aspires to wealth and glory only to find them, when achieved, a delusion leading to agony and shame. In Japanese with English subtitles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Uf-oh
results.creator_credit: Glenn Melenhorst, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Adrian (voice by Egan Gill) is quietly working on his computer, but his trusty companion, a bandicoot named Openhiemer (voice by Paul Gherig), has other plans. Openheimer meddles with the computers and taps into some alien life, causing all sorts of mischief.

results.title: U.N. Kindergarten
results.brief_description: Deals with the kindergarten set up to cater for the children of United Nations officials in New York. Children of 25 nationalities work and play together amicably as a practical example of international cooperation.

results.title: U.N. in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: With minimum supervision from their teacher, seventh-grade school children conduct a model classroom assembly, patterned after a session of the United Nations, and debate an issue. The film demonstrates an original approach in helping children get to know the world they live in.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and ONF | NFB

results.title: Tyrannosaurus Rex
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child”
Children are shown working together on a project to reconstruct the land of dinosaurs, using papier-mache to create hills, trees, a moat, and some shallow water. They paint and classify toy models of dinosaurs.

results.title: Typing technique
results.creator_credit: Michael Law and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A number of common errors by typists illustrated and corrected in a humorous manner. The items covered include the taking of dictation, proper sitting posture when typing, general typing technique and care of the machine.
